item.title: De Correspondent
item.description: De Correspondent is a crowdfunding project to start a new digital-only, subscription based news publication. Holding in-depth, quality journalism in higher regard than standard newsroom reporting, it will transform subscribers into shareholders and turn away from advertisers in exchange for partners. De Correspondent will be ambitious in its ideals and humble in its wisdom.
item.content:encoded: De Correspondent is a crowdfunding project to start a new digital-only, subscription based news publication. Holding in-depth, quality journalism in higher regard than standard newsroom reporting, it will transform subscribers into shareholders and turn away from advertisers in exchange for partners. De Correspondent will be ambitious in its ideals and humble in its wisdom.

item.title: 'Delicious' - Hong Kong Airport billboard graphics
item.description: Embroidered graphics created for Hong Kong Airport. The word "Delicious" was embroidered in six languages representing the different cuisines offered in the airport food halls. The word is spelled out using food from the various regions. Taking advantage of the texture and tactility of needlework we had the pleasure of creating these custom headlines out of very tasty food.
item.content:encoded: Embroidered graphics created for Hong Kong Airport. The word "Delicious" was embroidered in six languages representing the different cuisines offered in the airport food halls. The word is spelled out using food from the various regions. Taking advantage of the texture and tactility of needlework we had the pleasure of creating these custom headlines out of very tasty food.

item.title: Plus X Creative Partner Identity Design
item.description: Plus X has connotations of a message that ? We Add Experience for Your Brand.? Brand experience design means providing consumers with valuable brand experience through integrated online and offline designs based on the consistent brand strategy. Key brand messages or service functions can be effectively delivered when various media channels meet strategic marketing. In order to symbolize the purpose of the establishment of Plus X, the corporate symbol was designed with ?+? and ?x? which are considered most fundamental signs. We tried to maintain ?+X? for symbolizing our corporate identity,
item.content:encoded: Plus X has connotations of a message that ? We Add Experience for Your Brand.? Brand experience design means providing consumers with valuable brand experience through integrated online and offline designs based on the consistent brand strategy. Key brand messages or service functions can be effectively delivered when various media channels meet strategic marketing. In order to symbolize the purpose of the establishment of Plus X, the corporate symbol was designed with ?+? and ?x? which are considered most fundamental signs. We tried to maintain ?+X? for symbolizing our corporate identity,

item.title: Math:Rules - Strange Attractors
item.description: I wanted to create a series of pictures representing mathematical shapes on white background, like a "tribute to mathematics" that I often use in my work. I chose the "strange attractors" for their dynamic forms and "chaotic feel". Because I'm not a mathematician, I relied on several sites. Including one especially, very complete with free plugins for Cinema 4D making possible to configure these shapes easily. The site is in German, but Google translate did the job very well, so many thanks to the author !
item.content:encoded: I wanted to create a series of pictures representing mathematical shapes on white background, like a "tribute to mathematics" that I often use in my work. I chose the "strange attractors" for their dynamic forms and "chaotic feel". Because I'm not a mathematician, I relied on several sites. Including one especially, very complete with free plugins for Cinema 4D making possible to configure these shapes easily. The site is in German, but Google translate did the job very well, so many thanks to the author !

item.title: Vikings
item.description: Our task was to create a logo that would show the spirit of the Vikings' culture in its several main elements. In one symbol we needed to capture the multiple dimension of the nation. At the same time in the teaser we had to focus on how all the elements in logo are brought to life and coexist in Vikings' everyday life.
item.content:encoded: Our task was to create a logo that would show the spirit of the Vikings' culture in its several main elements. In one symbol we needed to capture the multiple dimension of the nation. At the same time in the teaser we had to focus on how all the elements in logo are brought to life and coexist in Vikings' everyday life.

item.title: WIDE AWAKE
item.description: The ?Global Trend Book? presents the latest automotive colours from Europe, the Asia-Pacific region and North America and explains trend backgrounds. One particular challenge was to develop a concept and a visual language which is accepted in both global and regional context. The book is divided into a trend part and an expandable, removable colour part for a high degree of flexibility in use. The parallel arrangement of both parts and the additional, visual-based orientation system ensures a clear presentation. Behold and awaken!
item.content:encoded: The ?Global Trend Book? presents the latest automotive colours from Europe, the Asia-Pacific region and North America and explains trend backgrounds. One particular challenge was to develop a concept and a visual language which is accepted in both global and regional context. The book is divided into a trend part and an expandable, removable colour part for a high degree of flexibility in use. The parallel arrangement of both parts and the additional, visual-based orientation system ensures a clear presentation. Behold and awaken!

item.title: Vevo
item.description: Music in Full Force We rebranded the #1 music video and entertainment platform to embody the thrill of discovering and experiencing the world?s best music. We?ve introduced a streamlined, lowercase logotype, creating a brand that celebrates fans. Expressive, in-your-face graphics, rich color, and strong typography reflect an infectious passion for music. A full motion graphics package for VEVO TV, the new 24-hour streaming video channel, brings music to life.
item.content:encoded: Music in Full Force We rebranded the #1 music video and entertainment platform to embody the thrill of discovering and experiencing the world?s best music. We?ve introduced a streamlined, lowercase logotype, creating a brand that celebrates fans. Expressive, in-your-face graphics, rich color, and strong typography reflect an infectious passion for music. A full motion graphics package for VEVO TV, the new 24-hour streaming video channel, brings music to life.

item.title: 01?The Type Collective
item.description: The Type Collective is a project initiated by eight designers: Andrei Ograd?, Alex Beltechi, Felix Hornoiu, Vlad Neuman, Koma, Nicu Duta, Octavian Budai & Vian Peanu. The idea was first brought up at an event held in Bucharest and quickly developed into the collaborative effort it is today?a playground dedicated to those who wish to experiment with typography and lettering. Realizing that such a thing has not yet been attempted in this neck of the woods, we decided to join forces and make it happen. These days we try to update the blog with nothing but our very own sketches, explorations and finished work. During the month of February 2013, we organized our first exhibition, which also happens to be the first of its kind in Bucharest. We are very pleased with the outcome and we hope to do it again soon! We're also interested in featuring guest artists for our next edition. If you think you've got the stones, drop us a line via the website!
item.content:encoded: The Type Collective is a project initiated by eight designers: Andrei Ograd?, Alex Beltechi, Felix Hornoiu, Vlad Neuman, Koma, Nicu Duta, Octavian Budai & Vian Peanu. The idea was first brought up at an event held in Bucharest and quickly developed into the collaborative effort it is today?a playground dedicated to those who wish to experiment with typography and lettering. Realizing that such a thing has not yet been attempted in this neck of the woods, we decided to join forces and make it happen. These days we try to update the blog with nothing but our very own sketches, explorations and finished work. During the month of February 2013, we organized our first exhibition, which also happens to be the first of its kind in Bucharest. We are very pleased with the outcome and we hope to do it again soon! We're also interested in featuring guest artists for our next edition. If you think you've got the stones, drop us a line via the website!

item.title: GE - Today's Future
item.description: Ars Thanea teamed up with TBWA/Shanghai to create the latest campaign for GE China. The ads and digital draw from the iconic visual texture of porcelain and tell the story of how GE technology transforms the lives of Chinese people.
item.content:encoded: Ars Thanea teamed up with TBWA/Shanghai to create the latest campaign for GE China. The ads and digital draw from the iconic visual texture of porcelain and tell the story of how GE technology transforms the lives of Chinese people.

item.title: AVL Magazin - Corporate Publishing
item.description: Vehicles are expected to offer more functionality while consuming less and less fuel. AVL helps to develop top performances and at the same time to use resources responsibly. With over 60 years of experience, advanced technologies and excellent service AVL plays an important role in future of automotive development. The new magazine FUEL shows its innovative work in the area of fuel consumption measurement systems. Corporate Publishing by moodley brand identity. CREDITS Client: AVL List GmbH Conception: Kirsten Ives, Sandra Raser Creative Direction: Mike Fuisz Art Direction: Kurt Glänzer Graphic Design: Kurt Glänzer, Michael Königshofer 3-D-Visualisation: Miro Klasnic/We Are Like Project Management: Christina Schachner Editing: Rudolf Binder, Sandra Raser Photographs: Marion Luttenberger, Christian Höhn, Oliver Sterk, Natalie Bothur, Visual Art House

item.title: Breitling for Bentley (Director's Cut)
item.description: "Time for Bentley" Bentley is present in the time of the Breitling. I symbolically expressed the Bentley melted in that Breitling watches through the Bentley constantly running over the face of the watches.

item.title: The Project Factory
item.description: The Project Factory is a digital production company that specialises in innovative and sustainable solutions across the online, mobile and gaming space. The brand refresh needed to align with a professional tone, as well as showcasing the company's creativity and diverse thinking. As the name suggests, the client also wanted to be seen as producers of a high volume of good quality work. After a great workshop session with the team, we determined three important points about the identity; 1. It needed to be progressive to reflect the attitude of the company 2. It needed to blur the line between professional practice and fun. 3. It needed to be flexible to cater for each facet of the target audience. The new brand is inspired by a rubix cube, introduced to reflect the communication and connections that the company has to offer, as well as alluding to a basic iteration of anything digital; the pixel. Included in the brand upgrade was an asset suite comprising of 24 symbols. The symbols act as a metaphor for the cogs of the factory turning, and are utilised across the collateral in a variety of ways to give a point of difference. A kinetic nature was brought into the fold, giving flexibility to applications across an online and digital context.
item.content:encoded: The Project Factory is a digital production company that specialises in innovative and sustainable solutions across the online, mobile and gaming space. The brand refresh needed to align with a professional tone, as well as showcasing the company's creativity and diverse thinking. As the name suggests, the client also wanted to be seen as producers of a high volume of good quality work. After a great workshop session with the team, we determined three important points about the identity; 1. It needed to be progressive to reflect the attitude of the company 2. It needed to blur the line between professional practice and fun. 3. It needed to be flexible to cater for each facet of the target audience. The new brand is inspired by a rubix cube, introduced to reflect the communication and connections that the company has to offer, as well as alluding to a basic iteration of anything digital; the pixel. Included in the brand upgrade was an asset suite comprising of 24 symbols. The symbols act as a metaphor for the cogs of the factory turning, and are utilised across the collateral in a variety of ways to give a point of difference. A kinetic nature was brought into the fold, giving flexibility to applications across an online and digital context.
